topics.description: Identifica las características actuales de la docencia virtual y  los cursos MOOCs, asumiendo su significado.
topics.title: Objetivo

topics.description: El módulo de Introducción a la Docencia Virtual, le permitirá conocer las características de la docencia virtual, las características de los cursos  MOOCs, su significado y los nuevos roles del docente y el estudiante virtual.
topics.title: Descripción

topics.description: En esta lección aprenderemos los tipos de aprendizajes utilizados en la docencia virtual, los tipos de interacciones que se producen en el aprendizaje colaborativo y las estrategias que podemos usar para orientar estos tipos de aprendizaje de manera eficaz.
topics.title: Trabajo Autónomo y Colaborativo Virtual

topics.description: El módulo de entornos colaborativos de aprendizaje, le permitirá conocer los tipos de actividades colaborativas de aprendizaje a partir del conocimiento y uso de las herramientas 2.0 en la educación
topics.title: Entornos Virtuales de Aprendizaje

items.long_description: Grant your collaborators permission to edit your course so you can work together.

items.short_description: Set Important Dates for Your Course
items.long_description: Establish your course's student enrollment and launch dates on the Schedule and Details page.
Set up your assignment types and grading policy even if you haven't created all your assignments.
Discover other available course authoring tools, and find help when you need it.

items.short_description: Create Your First Section and Subsection
items.long_description: Use your course outline to build your first Section and Subsection.
Specify the release dates for each Section in your course. Sections become visible to students on their release dates.
Set a Subsection to be graded as a specific assignment type. Assignments within graded Subsections count toward a student's final grade.
Use drag and drop to reorder the content in your course.
Rename Sections by clicking the Section name from the Course Outline.
Delete Sections, Subsections, or Units you don't need anymore. Be careful, as there is no Undo function.

items.short_description: Add an Instructor-Only Section to Your Outline
items.long_description: Some course authors find using a section for unsorted, in-progress work useful. To do this, create a section and set the release date to the distant future.
Access the Studio Help forum from the menu that appears when you click your user name in the top right corner of Studio.
Register for edX 101, edX's primer for course creation.
Download the searchable Studio reference documentation in PDF form.
Courses on edX have an About page that includes a course video, description, and more. Draft the text students will read before deciding to enroll in your course.
Showing prospective students who their instructor will be is helpful. Include staff bios on the course About page.
Include a short list of frequently asked questions about your course.
Let students know what knowledge and/or skills they should have before they enroll in your course.
